sn22.36:1.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and asked him,
sn22.36:1.3: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute.”
sn22.36:1.4: “Mendicant, you’re measured against what you have an underlying tendency for,
sn22.36:1.5: and you’re reckoned by what you’re measured against.
sn22.36:1.6: You’re not measured against what you have no underlying tendency for,
sn22.36:1.7: and you’re not reckoned by what you’re not measured against.”
sn22.36:2.1: “But how do you see the detailed meaning of my brief statement?”
sn22.36:2.2: “If you have an underlying tendency for form, you’re measured against that,
sn22.36:2.3: and you’re reckoned by what you’re measured against.
sn22.36:2.4: If you have an underlying tendency for feeling …
sn22.36:2.8: and you’re reckoned by what you’re measured against.
sn22.36:2.9: If you have no underlying tendency for form, you’re not measured against that,
sn22.36:2.10: and you’re not reckoned by what you’re not measured against.
sn22.36:2.11: If you have no underlying tendency for feeling …
sn22.36:2.14: consciousness, you’re not measured against that,
sn22.36:2.15: and you’re not reckoned by what you’re not measured against.
sn22.36:2.16: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
sn22.36:3.2: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.
sn22.36:3.3: If you have an underlying tendency for form, you’re measured against that,
sn22.36:3.4: and you’re reckoned by what you’re measured against.
sn22.36:3.5: If you have an underlying tendency for feeling …
sn22.36:3.9: and you’re reckoned by what you’re measured against.
sn22.36:3.10: If you have no underlying tendency for form, you’re not measured against that,
sn22.36:3.11: and you’re not reckoned by what you’re not measured against.
sn22.36:3.12: If you have no underlying tendency for feeling …
sn22.36:3.15: consciousness, you’re not measured against that,
sn22.36:3.16: and you’re not reckoned by what you’re not measured against.
sn22.36:3.17: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.” …
sn22.36:3.18: And that mendicant became one of the perfected.
